reviewText: This Winnie The Pooh series holds a very special place in my heart.  As a kid I watched Winnie The Pooh a lot.  I'm now a 29 year old man and I still love Pooh and his friends.  I remember my mother bought me this VHS years ago and I watched the crap out of it.  I wish Disney would release every episode of this series on DVD.  I would buy all of them.  VHS is a bit out of style nowadays.
I was glad to get the vhs tape of this series. I wish it was on dvd. Everyone loves this version of Winnie the pooh. when children make you watch over and over it better be comfortable to the adults.

This Winnie The Pooh vhs contains three classic stories

Stories are:

All's Well That Ends Wishing Well

Bubble Trouble

Where, Oh Where Has My Piglet Gone?

Ep. 26: All's Well That Ends Wishing Well
From Ep. 25: Bubble Trouble
From Ep. 29: Where Oh Where Has My Piglet Gone?

Highly recommend this for anyone who remembers this show and wants to re-watch it.

The New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh was a cartoon series that premiered in 1988 on The Disney Channel. 13 episodes aired before the show moved to ABC in the fall of 1988. Each episode was either a full length story that covered the entire episode, or two short stories that filled the episode. Season 1 had 22 episodes, Season 2 had 10 episodes, Season 3 had 10 episodes and Season 4 had 8 episodes, totaling 50 episodes and concluding in 1991. The series was then followed by a number of specials. In order, these were Winnie the Pooh and Christmas Too in 1991, Boo To You! Winnie the Pooh in 1996, A Winnie the Pooh Thanksgiving in 1998, Winnie the Pooh: A Valentine for You in 1999 and Winnie the Pooh; A Very Merry Pooh Year in 2002. As of 2012, Disney has yet to release the show as a complete series. The majority of episodes have however been released in various collections over the years. The only episodes not to be released in the US on any home media format are- Pooh Oughta Be in Pictures (the very first episode- this is available on the UK VHS video Hundred Acre Hero at Amazon.co.uk) Cleanliness Is Next to Impossible (episode 6- this is available on the UK VHS Bubbles and Troubles at Amazon.co.uk) To Be or Not To Bee (episode 38.1- not available on any home media format in the world) Sorry Wrong Slusher (episode 43- not available on any home media format in the world) The rest of the series has been released either on DVD or VHS. Now as to this specific Winnie the Pooh: All's Well That Ends Well VHS video. This is Volume 6 in The New Adventures of Winnie the Pooh VHS collection. The next one in the set is Winnie the Pooh 7: King of Beasties [VHS]. Episodes include: All's Well That Ends Wishing Well (Episode 26-1) (Also available on the VHS Winnie the Pooh: Tigger-Ific Tales [VHS] and the DVD Growing Up With Winnie the Pooh - A Great Day of Discovery) Bubble Trouble (Episode 25-1) (Also available on the DVD Growing Up with Winnie the Pooh - It's Playtime with Pooh) Where, Oh Where Has My Piglet Gone? (Episode 29-1) (Also available on the VHS Winnie the Pooh: Clever Little Piglet [VHS] and the DVD Growing Up With Winnie the Pooh - Friends Forever)
